alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 13 at 4:42PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall Possible Eastern Areas Of South Florida Middle Of This Week... A frontal boundary will move northward from the Florida Straits into South Florida during the middle of this week, as a non- tropical low moves eastward from the northern Gulf of Mexico into Northern Florida Peninsula. This will allow for the steering flow to become southwest with surface winds being east northeast over the region. This weather pattern will allow for deep tropical moisture to work into South Florida from the Southern Gulf of Mexico and the Caribbean Sea. The latest model guidance is showing the PWAT values rising to around 2.1 to 2.2 inches for middle of this week which is near the maximum values for this time of year over South Florida. Therefore, any showers or thunderstorms that do develop over the eastern areas of South Florida during the middle of this week will be capable of producing heavy rainfall. At this time, it looks like rainfall amounts could range between 2 to 4 inches over the eastern areas of South Florida, but there could be localized amounts up to 8 inches where any showers or thunderstorms train over the same area. The Weather Prediction Center has also put South Florida in a Marginal Risk of Flooding for middle of this week, but will continue to monitor the latest forecast to see if the flooding risk needs to to be upgraded to slight risk in later forecast.
